#sidebar TableOfContent
The library might or might not be plugged into your favorite genealogical-application. But as long as you have your family data available in a 
[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GEDCOM gedcom]http://gedcom2sem.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/wiki-images/icon_external_link_blue.png
file, you can always use the library on a command line. 

Get the latest version from the download section and unpack it. The contents of the zip and the tar.gz are identical. 
Below a partial example to execute a command. The ovals in the diagram on the [overview] page represent such commands. Replace the dots (...) with the  files from the same diagram. Put the output file last; the order of rules files is significant: they may need the results of a previous one. 
{{{
java -Xmx1024M -cp unzipped/gedcom2sem-XXX.jar gedcom2sem.semweb.Select ...
}}}

_Note_: on windows the slash should be in the other direction.

_Hint_: for quick and easy execution you can put the desired commands in a file. On Windows in a <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Batch_file">.bat http://gedcom2sem.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/wiki-images/icon_external_link_blue.png</a> file, on Mac/Unix in a <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shell_script">.sh http://gedcom2sem.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/wiki-images/icon_external_link_blue.png</a> file ._

See also these [https://code.google.com/p/gedcom2sem/source/browse/trunk/src/test/java/gedcom2sem/BatchExamples.java examples] expressed in java `JUnit` tests.
